p: Three selected cultivars of industrial hemp, namely Cannabis sativa L. cultivar ‘ Futura 75’ (F75), C. sativa L. cultivar ‘ Eletta campana’ (EC) and C. sativa L. cultivar ‘ Carmagnola selezionata’ (CS) were cultivated in experimental crops, in the Abruzzo region and more specifically in the surrounding of the Pescara river valley, Italy ( Table 1). This valley is a typical piedmont-hilly zone of the central-eastern Apennines, which originates from the ecotone between the Gran Sasso and Maiella-Morrone massifs, in the northern and southern part, respectively and declines within 45 km in an extended drainage basin to the Adriatic coast. The basin area expresses the Mediterranean bi-climate characters typical of the Adriatic coast with dry summer characterized by law rainfall. The total extension of the experimental crops were 24,000 square meters on level ground, with a mean slope lower than 5% and altitude range 70–100 m asl. The planting scheme was in lines with a central 2 m irrigation strip widths.
